p: In Siddha medicine, T. terrestris is known in Tamil as Nerunjil, yanai vanangi, thirikandam, siru nerunjil. In India—as Gokshur or Gokharu (in Sanskrit—gokshura, means the “cow’s hoof”, possibly because the small thorns tend to be stuck on grazing animals). This whole plant is used in the form of decoction to treat urinary tract infections, urolithiasis, dysmenorrhea, and edema. In Ayurvedic pharmacology, T. terrestris is used as a powder form of the aerial parts, particularly the fruits. In Europe, this species also named as puncture vine, “plant viagra” [ 31].
